result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin K. ROCKWELL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary as repeater-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary as repeater-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with the sentence presently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: To MX Mega Store, Attention:  David Klein at 3208 Menasha Avenue, Manitowoc, WI.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with MX Mega Store.

No association with any known drug dealers or users.

Defendant is to use only one doctor to prescribe medications and only one pharmacy to fill prescriptions, unless approved by the agent.

Undergo a mental health assessment if determined necessary by the agent.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with the sentence imposed on count 1 and concurrent with the sentence presently being served.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.   
Count 1 - Burglary, as repeater - Guilty plea.  
Count 2 - Burglary, as repeater - Guilty plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in count 3, burglary as repeater.  Motion granted.   Court orders a pre-sentence investigation repot to be completed by DOC.   Sentencing hearing is set for 03-15-16 at 1:30 p.m.  Report to be filed by 03-08-16.   Court orders bail revoked.   Defendant must submit DNA sample.   
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody on writ.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 12-10-15 at 2:30 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.
